body_content.explanation: to speak in a quick and confused way, producing short, unclear noises because of surprise, anger, etc.:
examples: "But, er ... when, um, ... how?" he spluttered.
The old gentleman was spluttering with indignation.
He sputtered an apology about being 14 minutes late.

body_content.explanation: (of a person) to produce short, unclear noises from your mouth, especially because you cannot breathe properly:
examples: Gasping, choking, spluttering, she struggled to escape.
She took too big a gulp of whisky and started to cough and splutter.

body_content.explanation: (of an engine or machine) to make a series of short, unclear noises:
examples: One of the engines spluttered as if it was short of fuel.
I can hear a coffee machine spluttering away.

body_content.explanation: the act of speaking in a quick and confused way, producing short, unclear noises, because of surprise, anger, etc.:
examples: I listened to his splutters of justification.
A few splutters of indignation could be heard from the back row.

body_content.explanation: short, unclear noises from your mouth, especially because you cannot breathe properly:
examples: She was struggling to make sense of the garbled words, splutters, and sneezes.

body_content.explanation: a series of short, unclear noises made by an engine or machine:
examples: She heard the cough and splutter of an aircraft engine.
